detaileddescription.para: Keeps track of found excited states. Convention: "0" is the biased seed, and others become unbiased by randomizing from state 0 (or any other). Therefore, this number is only incremented when randomizing the current state
Converged at least this many iters before success
True if projection has already been tried
True if full expansion has already been tried
True if damping of hamiltonian parameters is ongoing
Number of steps left doing chi-quenching
Number of bond dimension quench trials that have occurred
Maximum number of bond dimension quench trials allowed
Bond dimension during a quench
Bond dimension during a quench
Number of perturbation trials done
Maximum number of perturbation trials allowed
Number of steps left doing perturbation of MPOs
Number of steps left doing disorder damping of MPOs
Number of damping trials done
Maximum number of damping trials allowed
Iteration when last discard occurred
Counter for number of times discarding the smallest schmidt values
Maximum number of times to discard the smallest schmidt values
Counter for number of iterations of subspace expansion
Maximum number of iterations doing subspace expansion
Maximum value of subspace expansion factor
The current value of the subspace expansion factor
Exponents for for the damping trials

briefdescription.para: Dispatches finite DMRG stages. This function manages the stages of simulation differently depending on whether the data already existed in hdf5 storage or not.

detaileddescription.para: We start by searching the HDF5 group tree looking for

These are the scenarios: 1) The hdf5 file existed already and contains a) nothing recognizable (previous crash?) delete the file -> run full simulation from scratch. b) a converged simulation but no MPS run full simulation from scratch. c) a not-yet-converged MPS resume simulation, reset the number of sweeps first. d) a converged MPS not much to do... run postprocessing 2) The hdf5 file did not exist run full simulation from scratch. D1: output file exists: check option in settings::output::create_mode: - case OPEN: Load config and simulation state -> continue simulation - case RENAME: Rename output file -> go to D2 - case TRUNCATE: Delete output file -> go to D2
D2: output file does not exist: Check if coming from A2 - Yes: load simulation state from given hdf5 file -> continue simulation - No: start new simulation
